faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
faqs.description: Can’t find the answer you’re looking for? Don’t hesitate to get in touch with our
faqs.question1: What is the SEC API and what data can I access through it?
faqs.answer1: The SEC API provides access to financial data submitted to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, including company filings, financial statements, and more.
faqs.question2: How can I obtain an API key for accessing the SEC API?
faqs.answer2: To obtain an API key, you typically need to register on the SEC's official website or the platform providing the API service and follow their specific instructions for API access.
faqs.question3: What are the rate limits for the SEC API?
faqs.answer3: The rate limits for the SEC API can vary, but typically there are limits on the number of requests you can make per minute or per day. Check the API documentation for specific details.
faqs.question4: Can I use the SEC API for commercial purposes?
faqs.answer4: Yes, you can use the SEC API for commercial purposes, but you should review the terms of service to ensure compliance with any restrictions or requirements.
faqs.question5: What should I do if I encounter errors while using the SEC API?
faqs.answer5: If you encounter errors, consult the API documentation for troubleshooting tips. You can also contact the support team for further assistance.
